response.answer_text: Can we use the 3rd form of the verb with have been or has been? If yes, what is the rule? Ans: yes we can use v3 or 3rd form with has been or have been when we change voice or active to passive of present perfect per “ present perfect tense” which rule is “ subject- has/ have + 3rd form of verb+ object. Ex.I have done the work.[ Active] Ex.The work has been done by Me. Pleass upvote my answer if it is helpful.

Can we use the 3rd form of the verb with have been or has been? If yes, what is the rule? By the third form, I suppose you mean the past participle of the verb — the one ending in -ed with regular verbs. The answer is yes: we use it when writing in the passive voice. ‘He has opened the parcel’ (active). ‘The parcel has been opened by him’ (passive).
